basics.name: Deepa Chikkamath
basics.label: Master's Student
basics.summary: Master's Thesis Student at ESPCI Paris - PSL University, Paris, France. I am currently working on the analysis of turbulent flows in wind tunnels while performing experiments and simulations. This is part of my final year thesis at IISER Mohali where I am pursuing a BS-MS dual degree in Physics.

work.name: École Supérieure de Physique et de Chimie Industrielles (ESPCI) Paris - PSL University
highlights: I am studying oscillations in turbulence, where I am performing experiments in wind tunnels, using python for simulations and analysing the data to eventually realise the beahaviour of large scale turbulence.

work.name: Observatoire de Nice Côte d'Azur
highlights: I worked under the guidance of Prof. Giorgio Krstulovic at the Observatoire de Nice Côte d'Azur, France, from May 2024 to July 2024, with the Charpak Scholarship. I worked on understanding the role of compressibility in turbulent fluctuations in a two-dimensional fluid model (The Navier-Stokes equation). The results we found will be compared to the ones found for quantum turbulence (The Gross-Pitaevskii equation) in two dimensions. Learnt the theory of turbulence and used Matlab for 2D incompressible and compressible fluid models and calculated energy cascades, circulation, palinstrophy and enstrophy.

work.name: Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Dharwad
highlights: I worked under the guidance of Prof. Hiranya Deka on the theoretical and numerical modelling of the sealing dynamics of a drop impact on a liquid film. I learned numerical simulations on Basilisk, an open-source Navier Stokes Equation solver (successor of Gerris), the theory of fluid dynamics, computational fluid dynamics, drop dynamics.

work.name: Indian Institute of Science Education and Research (IISER) Mohali
highlights: I worked under the guidance of Prof. Rajeev Kapri on the theory of random walks and diffusion. I learned the basics of stochastic processes and their applications and used python to simulate random walks and diffusion processes. I also learned the theory of Brownian motion.

work.name: Indian Institute of Science Education and Research (IISER) Mohali
highlights: I worked under the guidance of Prof. Sandeep Goyal on the experimental quantum optics. I learned the basics of experimental setups and building models.
